reviews.text: Beautiful, peaceful and great place to sit to thing and pray. You can light candles that can be bought at the place, which is really good for someone's who find the place "by accident" like it was our case. Our Lady's image is hypnotizing. Definitely going back when in town.
A beautiful Romanesque church in the centre of Maastricht. Must visit to see the beauty shrine of our Lady of the Sea. Roman Catholic church with English mass at 5pm every Saturday
Great building. Full with history. Unfortunately the illumination inside is too weak,  so one cannot see all details of the beautiful interior architecture, icons and decorations.
An amazing authentic place. It makes you feel the passage of time....in this case centuries. A must visit in town
Beautiful church! Very welcoming for others! Although I’m from a different religion, but the church was very welcoming. I had visited this church in the time of Christmas!

There is a large stone covered area, like a large town square at the Town Hall. There are sidewalk cafes, many kinds of shops, and an information/visitors office where you can look for maps, tours, info, etc. At opposite end of square from Town Hall is a beautiful large cathedral.  Mozart and Handel played the large pipe organ there back in the day.
Beautiful building and area.
Historic City
Very nice place, have been inside and its just as nice there as from the outside
No need to watch your wallet here
Great contemporary art gallery/museum. Lockers are free of charge, rooms all have air conditioning. Nice cafe.

Unfortunately, I was too tired to explore the museum and had limited time in my hands. So, I just decided to walk to the museum. It’s a very nice and relaxing promenade from the center of Maastricht. I enjoyed the architecture from the outside and then I Simply browsed the museum store. They have very interesting things but my favorite is the sell of original art ready to hang and we’ll priced!

The David Lynch exhibition was excellent. If not for the voucher, part of the David Lynch experience, which promised a 'damn fine coffee and cherry pie', 4 instead of 3 stars, since they ran out of the latter. Come on.
Very nice Museum. David Lynch exposition. Awesome
Great architecture and exhibition. To top it off, a ceramic nasal douche that must be one of the first. You know, it's great if you have a nose.

Nice museum in a beautiful and calm part of the city. Employees are kind and helpful. The museum is not flashy or innovative in the set-up, nor is it very big. The entrance fee however is quite low and all the information that is accessible, is good. So the price quality is fine. Take about two hours to stroll easily through the museum and spend the rest of the day enjoying the beauty that is the city of Maastricht.
Small yet very educative on geological history. Great for kids as well!
Nice museum to visit. Many details about nature including extinct and exist animals, big and small sizes. They also have temporary exhibition, it was about insect photography when I went.
Small but interesting museum, however most info provided in Dutch only

Small museum, but certainly a must see in the town. In a cozy atmosphere you could enjoy a nice collection within permanent, temporary exhibitions and outside. 
The specialty of museum is ancient animals found very close by to Maastricht - mammoths and dinos. 
It is a nice visit for both children and adults. Small souvenir shop is available.

My favorit place for afternoon cycling.
The best location for outdoor activities in Maastricht.
The Marl quarry in Maastricht is a stunning and entertaining place to visit. I can recommend taking a guided tour around and inside the caves to both adults and children. Very well done!
Impressive and fun!

My favourite place to go for a walk in Maastricht. Beatiful corners of nature. Nice view from the altitude at Maastricht, old quarry, artificial lakes with bluish greenish water. Place popular for joggers, dogs owners. At the same time ine can say it is silent enough to find a rest from the civilisation. :)
it is not a mount
Very good homemade fry food shop with a lot of selection. The owners are very friendly and welcoming !

If fries and deep fried snacks is your thing, this is definitely one of the better places in Maastricht to get them. Fries and a lot of the snacks are home made as are the sauces to accompany them. Besides the tasty fries, I tried the home made beef croquet and it's so good, I'll have a hard time passing by this shop without walking in. Definitely going back to try the shrimp croquet as well.
Very good fries
Best fries ever tasted. The home made snacks and sauces are amazing as well.
Probably one of the best fries that i ate until now. Crispy, Tasty that you can't stop actually :-). Would come back again very soon !
Very nice fries. I ordered the chicken satay and it was very tasty and of course served with fries. You can also get the fries to take away or you can be seated
Best fries!!! So many sauces to choose from. Our favourite is the special sauce, it's sweet but light with crunchy bits of onions.

Best fries I ever had in my life.
I went to Maastricht in 2014 and I still miss the city and yes this shop is one of the reason . I really wish if I can visit this shop once more before I die.

Waited 20min to get some fries. The queue is ridiculous but the staff is friendly and really fast.
Prices are 3.5€ for big fries and 3€ for small ones. Sauces cost too much in my opinion but you get enough to cover your whole fries. But the take out sauces are even more expensive and you get a really small amount, so I don't recommend them.
The fries taste mediocre. Nothing special and they taste a lot like flour, so we were really disappointed. Don't get the hype about this place. 
In short I don't recommend this place.
Good fries, great sources.

Please do not eat here!! Sweet and sour chicken = rice + chicken + a scoop of tinned fruit salad(?!?). I'm not sure how anyone can charge 6.95 for that... I have so many questions, like who serves tinned fruit salad to the public? And why would you put that in this dish?? Fresh capsicum/paprika or pineapple maybe, but not tinned peaches and grapes... Very odd combination.
Even inside the restaurant only plastic dishes and not really asian style. Vegetables mushy and the dishes not very tasty.
Everything were very fine but not tasty...TT
Wok to go... and never come back! Seriously... dont go here. This is the worst take-out the entire city has to offer.
Very ordinary place, if you can spend few euros more, find another place.
Go, there is no other option!! Perfect food and excellent service
Nice atmosphere and very delicious Food.
Good location, decent food selection.  The service was efficient.  I don't find the waiters in the Netherlands nearly as friendly as the staff in South Africa but they weren't unfriendly either.
Pretty bad lunch. Ordinary soup. Awful sweet stew. 3 years old is eating his soup with a super uncomfortable spoon. Would never recommend this place.
Good cappuccino and an enjoyable time spend in this café.

Great food and one of the few outdoors with full protection from the weather. A good menu in English. Service was good. We would have had another round of drinks but follow up was a little slow after our meal so we got our bill instead.
The only place you dont feel a "tourist trap"
Nice place, free WiFi, and friendly service.
Second time that I come to this restaurant. PERFECT for people with gluten intollerance . Keep it up!
Small portions. Big prices.
Be sure to go and visit this place when you like a good piece of pie! All is homemade and different varieties are available.
The best Dutch pie's in town! Must try the cherry one. It's scrumptious

A rich variety of pies (vlaaien) that are deliciously homemade. Very good value for the price and friendly staff. The ambiance of the place is very nice, and the coffee is great. The place to get a vlaai in Maastricht!
Loved the Limburg Vlaai. The crust was different from the fruit pie I usually have. The service was also very friendly. The coffee was not so great though.

Great place to enjoy a piece of vlaai or something else from the bakery. However, the guy serving us was a little bit grumpy. The woman in the bakery was very nice and we had a little chat about Maastricht!

Nice quite place. Nice staff. Good attentive service. I had the Lunch Special Lobster Roll, but I did not like it. Other than that everything else was good. Be sure you keep an eye on your parking meter outside.

Excellent food and service. The menu has a nice variety of Japanese and Thai dishes to choose from. All of the food tastes fresh, and is presented in a lovely way. The servers are all really nice and helpful with suggestions on what to order. It's a nice little restaurant, modern, clean, and cozy. It's quickly becoming one of our favorites!
Absolutely fantastic! Excellent food. Great selection of dishes. Incredible presentation. Reasonable prices. Plentiful portioned plates. This is a must-visit restaurant.

We were looking for somewhere quick near an upcoming appointment that was not fast food. My niece and I were seated right away and ordered within three minutes. Less than ten minutes later we were enjoying delicious lunch specials. The portion size was more than fair for the great lunch price.

I met and chatted with Will, one of the chef/owners over lunch today.  Very nice, approachable dude.  The atmosphere was relaxed.  The food was beautifully presented, perfectly fresh, delicious and fairly priced.  Will be returning.

Took 1 hour and 40 minutes to get food for 4 people (we only ordered one main dish each). There were 3 tables that arrived after us but received their food before we did. 

One table with 3 people that arrived just after us received their starters, main dish, dessert, paid and even left before we got our main dish! 

After 1 hour and 10 minutes we asked the waiter who said our food would be ready in 3 minutes and then just ignored our table for another 30 minutes after which our food finally arrived. When it finally arrived, the rice was cold!!! Ridiculous!!! 

No apologies or compensation, they told us we should be understanding because there was only one chef there. We didn’t order anything out of the ordinary that would take too long to prepare. It seems they just prioritized the tables with fewer people. 

Don’t go there. I would give 0 stars if possible. Not recommended.

Service was so slow that we got irritated at one point in time. We had to wait for an hour. They kept taking orders from people but did not even tell that it would take time or something. Kept a lot of people waiting. They were not even bothered to inform people about the delay. And when the food arrived we were even more disappointed. We ordered Paneer and to our surprise there was only 1 or 2 thin pieces of Paneer. A very small portion they served. Highly dissatisfied with the service and taste of food.

Nice cost place. It's managed by husband wife and very delightfully served. Food is different means If you are an Indian you will be puzzled.. But non Indian will like the food. I had Veg thai there... And Nan was just awesome. Over all good place to go..
Very nice and spicy food. I enjoyed vegetarian food. I do recommend for flavoured asian tast.
Great place! Very nice people, I highly recommend it!
